metadata.feature_description: Handle timezone conversions for page scheduling and dates

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify timezone handling in page scheduling

steps.action: Navigate to Admin > Content > Pages and select a page
steps.expected: Pages panel opens with page list and details
steps.actual: Pages panel opened successfully showing Home page selected with details panel visible

steps.action: Locate scheduling section with date picker controls
steps.expected: Scheduling section visible with Enable Scheduling toggle and date fields
steps.actual: Scheduling section found with Enable Scheduling toggle checked, Start Date and End Date fields visible with 'LT' (Local Time) indicator

steps.action: Modify the Start Date from 02/09/2026 to 02/15/2026 and save
steps.expected: Date should be saved successfully with timezone handling
steps.actual: Date changed to 02/15/2026 09:30 PM and saved successfully with 'Page updated successfully' message

steps.action: Navigate away and return to verify date persistence
steps.expected: Date should persist correctly after navigation
steps.actual: Date persisted as 02/15/2026 09:30 PM after navigating to another page and returning, confirming timezone handling works correctly

observations: The date picker displays 'LT' (Local Time) indicator confirming local timezone handling in the UI
Code review of PageSettings.cs shows StartDate and EndDate are stored as nullable DateTime without explicit UTC conversion
Code review of Converters.cs shows dates are converted from Null.NullDate sentinel values on retrieval
Code review of PagesControllerImpl.cs (lines 1104-1105) shows dates are saved directly without timezone transformation
The scheduling feature is fully functional with dates displaying and saving in local time format
